item.title: Croutons
item.description: Croutons are an essential addition to many salads. They are delicious and easy to make at home. Ingredients Hearty White Bread Extra Virgin Olive Oil Spices Directions Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (roughly 180¬∞C). Gently cut slices of white bread into squares with a chef’s knife. One to two slices is usually enough for one person. In a large bowl combine olive oil, spices, and bread squares and gently mix to thoroughly season bread.

item.title: Flammkuchen
item.description: A recipe for Flammkuchen a very thin crust pizza-like dish - it originates from Elsass, a French region close to where I grew up. I like the recipe because it takes 10 minutes to prepare and another 10 minutes to bake. It goes well with a green salad as a side. üçΩÔ∏è Servings:2 Ingredients 400g Pizza dough (either bought or from Pizza Dough) 1 onion (I prefer the red ones for optical reasons) 150g bacon (you can replace it with mushrooms or other vegetables) 2 big spoons of sour creme or creme fraiche Directions we start by flattening the dough.

item.title: French Cr√™pes
item.description: Like pancakes, but very thin. 15 cr√™pes. Ingredients 300g white flour 3 eggs 60cl milk 20cl beer 30g butter or 3 tablespoons of oil Directions Mix flour, salt, eggs and melted butter or oil. (In this order to avoid dry flour) Slowly add milk and beer until the dough becomes fluid enough. (Pouring it from the ladle has to be fluid) Let it rest one hour. (optional) Cook the cr√™pe in a flat pan, one ladle at a time.

item.description: French bistrot style porkchops with a mustard, white wine and gherkins sauce. Very quick to cook. üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 4 Ingredients porkchops: 4 shallots: 2 gerkins: a dozen medium sized ones white wine: 350ml | 1 1/2 cup brown stock: 100ml | 1/2 cup mustard: 2tbsp butter vegetable oil Directions Cut the shallots into small dices.
